blurbs.text:
「きみの瞳（め）に、私はどう観測（うつ）ってる？」

中学時代のトラウマから人と距離を置き、
一人で学校生活を送っていた寺館天。
しかしある日、遠い異星のお姫様・ルルがやって来て、
天の花嫁になると告げる。
静かで孤独だった天の青春は大きく変わり始めて…。

review.comments:

I'd be really interested in reading this if they had a different protagonist though.

**[DeepL Translation - needs review]** Introduction to Volume 1: What's it like to live in Hokkaido?
Tsukiko, who lives in Sapporo, has just quit her job.
When she starts to have too much time on her hands, her friend Chitose invites her to go to Ota

第1巻の内容紹介: 北海道で暮らすってこんな感じ？

時間を持て余し始めたところで、友達のちとせに誘われて、列車で小樽に遊びに行くことに。
ちょっと自由で開放的な人たちが、自然や異国情緒溢れる北海道の各所を背景に、ゆるゆると生き方と暮らしを考える。

review.comments:
...I genuinely have a feeling this might be my favorite manga of all time, the panels with yakiniku together, or making bears together, or the shoutouts to Denmark and Switzerland, or onsen, driving a car, having a map of where each chapter took place, it's just, AAAAA :DDDD

I love 月子 so much she be like me frfr

**[DeepL Translation - needs review]** Introduction to Volume 1: What's it like to live in Hokkaido?
Tsukiko, who lives in Sapporo, has just quit her job.
When she starts to have too much time on her hands, her friend Chitose invites her to go to Ota

第1巻の内容紹介: 北海道で暮らすってこんな感じ？
札幌で暮らす月子は仕事をやめたばかり。
時間を持て余し始めたところで、友達のちとせに誘われて、列車で小樽に遊びに行くことに。
ちょっと自由で開放的な人たちが、自然や異国情緒溢れる北海道の各所を背景に、ゆるゆると生き方と暮らしを考える。
新感覚ライフスタイル漫画！

review.comments:
I come to realize that I freaking love adventure travel manga where the authors appreciate the culture that they write about, and make dozens of tangents and sprinkle their own experiences: I find this one to be as fun as 北国ゆらゆら紀行, you can tell that the author put her heart into this one and really wanted to tell a story, or maybe many stories, and it shows itself in the bonus features at the end of the manga as well ^^

In terms of the language though: because it's about tourism, dialogues use pretty simple grammar and simple language, but the actual inner thoughts use a decent amount of formal forms and some rare and hard-to-understand words, so don't hesitate to use Mokuro on this one: the level is a bit uneven ^^

item.author: ぽぬむら

blurbs.text:
**[DeepL Translation - needs review]** An all-happy collection of yuri manga short stories. Includes a variety of couplings, from that girl you just pass by every morning that you are curious about to that girl caught in the middle of the yuri.
Omnib

オールハッピーな百合漫画短編集。毎朝すれ違うだけの気になるあの子から百合に挟まれるあの子まで、いろいろなカップリングを収録。
オムニバス形式のショート漫画と読み切り中編漫画をカラーページ多めで掲載しています。
学生から社会人までさまざまな組み合わせの百合な日常をどうぞ。

review.comments:
I feel baited into this one, and less pleasantly so: it took me a few dozen pages to realize that this is a 青年 manga, and I was like "yeah I can live with that", but then the stories started being very, _very_ vanilla, very, very moe, and some of the scenarios made me actively roll my eyes: there is a moment somewhere around 80-100 pages where the stories start converging and make a bigger sense together and that made me think that maybe it wasn't a 青年 manga after all, but then the final few pages reaffirmed my suspicion and I felt deflated.

Not my favorite thing I read today ;\_\_\_;

blurbs.text: Konohagakure no Sato, the Village Hidden in the Leaves, is one of the five great ninja villages of the world. Uzumaki Naruto, a boy who lives in the village, struggles after repeatedly failing the ninja academy final exam. Unbeknownst to him, he hold

忍び五大国の一国、火の国の中にある木ノ葉隠れの里。里に住むうずまきナルトは、忍者学校の試験に何度も落ちているおちこぼれ。赤ん坊のときに、里を襲った化け狐の尾獣九尾をその体内に封印されている人柱力であるため、里の人々からうとんじられ、孤独な生活を送るナルトだったが、夢は里の長である火影になること。忍者学校の卒業試験に合格し、忍となったナルトは、同じ班に配属されたうちはサスケ、春野サクラたちと共に困難な任務に挑んでいく。

review.comments:
Amazing for consuming N3-level content: it's very easy to ingest and does challenge readers with some more difficult text among the easier ones, also I still crush on Deidara and Temari frfrfr xddd

It's a little harder to look at Naruto with pink-tinted glasses now and there were a few moments when my attention was going like "i literally don't care", but if you think about how important it is to remember the side-character names to play them in Ultimate Ninja Storm afterwards, then there is a delayed gratification from it ^^

Fun and light read! C:

review.comments:
still is very cute, this volume had a bit more wordplay variety (one character that speaks only in katakana), but the difficulty hasn't changed much, and there's some really pretty panels in this one, some really cool fights and iconic 術s were being cast in this volume ^^

still pretty basic Japanese though: doesn't get into many dialects and is straightforward with the labels, and furigana makes it easier to absorb vocab like a sponge ^^

ルージュの記憶 has no right to go this hard wtf

i'm a fan of YEARNING and that was screaming YEARNING at me AAAAA

also, some of the anniversary stories were pretty cute and it was a fun challenge to read this one, happy to be behind it now ^^

review.comments:
This manga is using a ton of really beautiful language, and at my current level of Japanese proficiency, I can’t help but wish it didn't, at least not so much

This so far is the single hardest thing I've ever attempted to read in Japanese, including books and visual novels, and even if you decipher the words already, you still have grammar that doesn't easily stick with those words either

But I'm glad I had this experience and the misfortunes of 莉莉 and 慧月 were fun to follow ^^

Also, my new favorite panel that says 自由, very pretty C:

I want to get to this manga again sometime in the future ^^

blurbs.text: Fashionable and upbeat high schooler Aya falls head over heels for an employee at a local CD shop. He’s got an air of mystery about him, always dressed well, and has impeccable taste in music. Little does she know—this supposedly male employee is act

CDショップで働いているミステリアスな「おにーさん」が気になってしょうがない女子高生・あや。しかし「おにーさん」の正体は、話したこともない、クラスメイトの目立たない女子・みつきだった――。
SNSで最高に注目を集める女同士の「愛情」を巡る物語、待望の書籍化。みつきの過去をめぐる描き下ろしストーリーを収録。

review.comments:
yeah akatsukinoluna made me read this one too xdd

This one felt a bit easier in terms of comics to read than the 33rd, also, congratulations on having made it to the 8th anniversary!

The 140-character story that got chosen as a story of the issue was pretty sweet, and the Kindle Unlimited recommendations of ルミナス＝ブルー and 学校が違うふたり are something I'm willing to dig into as well ^^

Most amusing comic award goes to とろける部屋のなか, there were two moments when I smirked through my nose

The short story, 私の林檎, used a decent few characters I was not familiar with, so that story slowed me down once again and was probably the hardest part of the magazine, but the other in-magazine features and interview felt more manageable

If going in just for manga, L26 would be fine, story could be level 30? Still not very familiar with the rating structure.

The language is perfectly manageable, there is furigana for the difficult words (and there aren't even that many of them!), but the volume of text in chapter 4 can be overwhelming

item.author: 水凪トリ

blurbs.text: **[DeepL Translation - needs review]** Volume 1 Introduction: Satoko Mugimaki has an immune system disease. She lives part-time four times a week. The doctor recommends that she "look for a marriage," but Satoko decides to move to an apartment comple
第1巻の内容紹介: 免疫系の病気を持っている麦巻さとこ。週4回のパート暮らし。お医者さんから「婚活でも」と勧められたけれど、さとこが決めたのは家賃の安い団地への引っ越し!　面倒見の良すぎる大家・鈴さんとその息子・司との交流や、団地ののどかな時間に心身ともに癒やされて…。

review.comments:
...the subject matter of this one is a bit hard for me to grasp, because this book speaks about disability and attempts to spin it into "disability isn't the end of the world, haha!", but reading through this, I feel like I personally would hate to be in the shoes of the main character, even when she's trying her best to make things work.

I think this story has a lot of interesting linguistic bits and I'm glad I read it, but I found it to be hard to relate to and a bit sad in places where it wasn't supposed to be sad, so melancholy is a strong word with this one.

and the horrifying thing: she actually does xddddd

First time in a while a digital read and without mokuro: went in reeeeally quickly and i didn't have to look up a single word, so it's great for consuming a lot of characters quickly ^^

blurbs.text: **[DeepL Translation - needs review]** Volume 1 Introduction: In junior high school, Hana was called a "stone" and forgot how to cry or laugh. She admires a lemon-haired boy she met by chance, Miura-kun, and enrolls in the same high school, but...?　H
第1巻の内容紹介: 中学時代、「石」と呼ばれ、泣くことも笑うことも忘れていた羽花。偶然出会ったレモン色の髪の男の子・三浦くんに憧れて、同じ高校に入学したけれど──!?　ソーダ水のように甘く弾ける青春が、ここからはじまる！

review.comments:
I was really surprised by the fact this magazine even EXISTS in the first place

You can tell that the stories are written by people who care about emotions more than about complex stories, and I feel like the demographic of this one is older than コミック百合姫, it's also harder to read (no furigana! and sometimes the word choices lean a bit more unconventional) and there are some text inserts that use more noble and more honorable language as well

Favorite part: definitely the 140-character 百合 stories, 雪 even got an illustration!
There is a story in the middle, ごめんね、愛してる, that uses a tiiiny, tiiiny text and a lot of difficult words: I think this magazine might peak at level 32 difficulty, but I'm not very familiar with the grading standard yet.

I'm really happy I was able to read it though!

意味…土星の公転周期が約30年であること。そのことから占星術では、約30年に一度、人生での大

review.comments:
I really enjoyed this one: I was looking for more realistic portraits of adult people living their lives in Japan, and I thought that this was a very refreshing read. It is adult people being sad, there is some Sally Rooney longing and nostalgia in this one, but I thought it was a pretty solid story all things considered. And the illustrations are beautiful, there are multiple panels with a full page illustration just letting you narrow in on the desperation of the characters!

It introduces a bunch of pretty useful vocabulary related to the ovulation, suicide, there's some sonkeigo in the mix, the wordbook is pretty specialized here, but it helped me learn a thing or two ^^

彰子 is the best character frfr

they fed a gorilla a crate of bananas so its an easy four stars

I found this one to be pretty unimaginative through most of it: it puts characters through very familiar scenarios and age gap/teacher-student is one of the common ones, I find it's cool that the artists were featured and were given a spotlight to show, but apart from 後悔に抱かれてろ, that was an exploration of shame that I found pretty interesting - the rest wasn't as touching.

blurbs.text: **[DeepL Translation - needs review]** Volume 1 Introduction: After failing the university entrance exam, Wataru returns to the countryside. He finds no place for himself at home with his strict parents.... Then he is reunited with Sayoko, a childhoo
第1巻の内容紹介: 大学受験に失敗し、田舎へ戻ってきた渉。厳格な両親のいる家では、渉の居場所がなかった…。そんなとき、少年時代に一緒に遊んでいた幼なじみの紗夜子と再会するのだった。妖艶に成長していた紗夜子に、渉は惹かれていく。しかし、紗夜子には秘密があるのだった――！禁断のラブサスペンス第１巻――!!

review.comments:
The bits and pieces are there: this manga has an incredible artstyle and I truly treasure what the artist was making in order to differentiate this story from the novel and anime, but I think it cuts away some of my favorite pieces of both as well - I think second volume might go hard with the wordplay, but part of the magic of 化物語 is the crazy unassuming setups that it's very easy to miss, but they pay off a few thousand pages later, and when you go back you go like, "i can't believe it's been spelled out in the very first book/episode all along", and this manga had a few of it, but the foretelling was significantly limited.

I still had a lot of fun though, and the level of Japanese needed for this one flips and changes over about as quickly as the tone of the volume ^^

まだ“情熱”って言葉さえ知らない、小学校6年生の千早。
そんな彼女が出会ったのは、福井からやってきた転校生・新。大人しくて無口な新だったが、彼には意外な特技があった。それは、小倉百人一首競技かるた。千早は、誰よりも速く誰よりも夢中に札を払う新の姿に衝撃を受ける。しかし、そんな新を釘付けにしたのは千早のずば抜けた「才能」だった……。

review.comments:
A story mostly centering about sadness, the characters are trying to find joy in each other's presence, but it feels like they suspect their affection might not actually lead them to happily ever after. There is some longing, distant loneliness, and the photography theme feels just like an excuse: this story doesn't use the theme of photography as much as something like Life is Strange would for example.

It's very pure, very vanilla and very clean, not that many キューン moments though ^^

item.author: 石田 スイ

review.comments:
I remember watching the anime a few years ago thinking "ehhh it's nothing that big" - but in this very volume, there was one very, very gruesome death that made me sick even just thinking about this: I wonder if it's a bit, like, growing up, you gravitate towards "edgy things" because they're so far removed from the mainstream they make you feel something, but then you get to this point in life where this murder scene appears and you go like WHY WOULD YOU EVEN WRITE THIS WHAT THE HECK IS WRONG WITH YOU

Anyway, fun manga and illustrations are beautiful: i read this one physically without Mokuro and there were a decent few head-scratchers, but nothing preventing me from understanding the main plot of the volume: plus the illustrations are very expressive and help you understand things, even the mourning scenes that normally don't express emotions that well have been very animated in this manga.

blurbs.text: THE THIRST Nothing interesting is happening in Makoto Ozaki's first year of high school. His life is a series of quiet humiliations: low-grade bullies, unreliable friends, and the constant frustration of his adolescent lust. But one night, a pale, th
第1巻の内容紹介: 謎の少女に襲われ、決断を迫られたあの夜──。幸せでも、不幸でもなかった僕のありきたりな日常は、跡形もなく壊れてしまった…。首筋に残った“傷”。何かを求めて、止まない“渇き”。冴えない高校生だった、岡崎を待ち受ける運命とは…!?

review.comments:
It's very easy to consume and pretty quick to read, but I'm a bit in the "little text does not mean easy text" camp, I went into this expecting something I wouldn't be challenged by at all, and within the first few pages I was immediately like "wowwow, this doesn't look like a N5/N4 word".

Mangas that have less text risk this thing that the moment you miss one word, you miss the whole context of the scene: there have been a few moments when a big word appeared on the screen, and unless you know its meaning, you would be stuck.

Luckily, I personally didn't get stuck on any of the words though, but I did look up a few things with Mokuro just to make sure I have it all right.

I was a little less polite on the previous volume, but this is _exactly_ my flow state level with reading in Japanese, reading the second volume and being in the story at the moment and following 100% of the events just felt GREAT, I'm probably this level on Natively as of today ^^

Bumping the "language learning rating" to 5, I learned so, so much from this volume today!
